key.name: enabled
key.description: If true, MATE HUD will run when invoked.

key.name: shortcut
key.summary: The keyboard shortcut used to pop-up the MATE HUD
key.description: The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1". The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>".

key.name: rofi-theme
key.summary: The rofi theme to use for the HUD
key.description: MATE HUD uses rofi to display the HUD. Specify the rofi theme to use here. 'mate-hud' and 'mate-hud-rounded' try to pull colors from the GTK theme. Find available themes in /usr/share/rofi/themes or put your own in ~/.local/share/rofi/themes

key.name: hud-monitor
key.summary: Whether to pin the HUD to the monitor or to the current window
key.description: Whether to pin the HUD to the monitor or to the current window

key.name: location
key.summary: Where to position the HUD on the window (or monitor)
key.description: Where to position the HUD on the window (or monitor)

key.name: custom-width
key.summary: A custom width in pixels for the HUD (Will be ignored if less than 400)
key.description: A custom width in pixels for the HUD (Will be ignored if less than 400)

key.name: menu-separator
key.summary: A character to separate the parts of the menu heirarchy in the HUD
key.description:
A character to separate the parts of the menu heirarchy in the HUD.
Can be entered as a single character or the Unicode code point in hexadecimal notation (leading 0x optional)
or 'default' which will give » for LTR languages and « for RTL languages
Valid examples: '>', '-', '0x25b8', '25B8', '▸', 'default'
Invalid: '--' (too many characters), '25B8B8' (outside of valid range)

key.name: tap-timeout
key.summary: The timeout between key press and release to determine if the user meant to open MATE HUD
key.description: This only applies to single key shortcuts (e.g. `Alt_L`). It prevents the HUD from showing up if the user keeps the shortcut pressed for longer than the timeout. Set to 0 to disable the timeout.
